H0.text: Diabetes is the disease caused by the transformation of proto‑oncogenes into oncogenes, which leads to unregulated cell division.

H1.text: Leukemia is caused by changes at the molecular level that turn proto‑oncogenes into oncogenes, leading to unregulated cell division.

H2.text: Pneumonia is a disease caused by the transformation of proto‑oncogenes into oncogenes at the molecular level, which leads to unregulated cell division.

H3.text: Hemophilia is a disease caused by changes at the molecular level that turn proto‑oncogenes into oncogenes, leading to unregulated cell division.

A4.text: The Philadelphia chromosome, caused by a translocation of pieces from chromosomes 9 and 22, leads to the Bcr-Abl gene, which is constitutively active and causes uncontrolled cell proliferation.

A5.text: The unregulated expression of this protein activates other proteins that are involved in cell cycle and cell division which can cause a cell to grow and divide uncontrollably (the cell becomes cancerous).
